text: MTb - induced HIV-1 replication in PBMC depends on binding of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF-kappaB to the LTR .
Specific disruption of the NF-kappaB or NFAT5 binding sites in the HIV-1 subtype B LTR inhibits R5-tropic virus replication in human PBMC after co-infection with MTb .

PBMC from four normal donors were infected with 1000 TCID50 HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - WT or the mutants HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB I-Mut , HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB II-Mut , HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - kappaB I+II-Mut , or HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - N5-Mut and either ; ( A ) left untreated , or ( B ) co-infected with MTb isolate CDC1551 ( 10 : 1 cells : bacilli ) .
Viral <extra_id_0> p24 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in culture supernatants were measured at days 4 , 7 and 12 post-infection .
( C ) Histograms show viral <extra_id_0> p24 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels at day 12 in the MTb uninfected ( grey bars ) and MTb co-infected ( black bars ) PBMC cultures .
Replication of the mutant viruses was compared to wild-type virus replication under the same experimental conditions ( without and with MTb co-infection , respectively ) .
* , p < 0.05 ; ** , p < 0.01 , as compared to HIV-1Lai / Bal-Env-WT .
